Actuators.description: Perfecting the art of making things mobile, without the explicit use of explosives. Our engineers assure us, this is actually a good thing.

Adv._Fuel_Systems.description: Advanced Advancements towards a better understanding of how fuel flows through a rocket.

Advanced_Aerodynamics.description: Advances in fluid dynamics research technology have allowed development of a new set of streamlined aircraft components. And also these parts here.

Advanced_Construction.description: New advances in construction make it possible to build larger than ever before.

Advanced_Electrics.description: We're fairly certain no one will ever need more than 64kw of power for anything.

Advanced_Exploration.description: They are Self-Deploying Astronaut Mobility Enhancement Devices, I don't know what you mean by "ladders".

Advanced_Flight_Control.description: The latest advancements in keeping the correct end of the ship pointing towards where you want it to go.

Advanced_Landing.description: Further advances in landing devices, allowing for more controlled descents and a much higher number of parts still attached to the ship after touchdown.

Advanced_MetalWorks.description: These new construction techniques allow for craft designs that were considered insane not too long ago... and still are. But they're now possible!

Advanced_Motors.description: Wheel technology is just rolling along now. You could even say our engineers are on a roll with it.

Advanced_Rocketry.description: A new step ahead in rocket technology.

Advanced_Science_Tech.description: Scientific advancements allow new advanced technologies for advancing Science.

Advanced_Unmanned_Tech.description: Improvements in remote control technology for a new generation of probe designs.

Aerodynamics.description: New breakthroughs from C7 Aerospace allow for new types of craft to be built. We're looking into hiring some of their engineers as well.

Aerospace_Tech.description: The absolute cutting-edge in aerospace technology. Quite literally, some of those edges are very sharp. Handle with care.

Automation.description: We can't think of anything that could go wrong with letting an experimental AI handle every aspect of a mission.

Aviation.description: The art and science of keeping heavier-than-air objects aloft for extended periods of time.

Basic_Rocketry.description: How hard can Rocket Science be anyway?

Basic_Science.description: We are going to ask the big questions of the Universe... eventually. For now, we're starting with these.

Command_Modules.description: Flight control technology has evolved far enough that we feel we can honestly say pilots are in command now.

Composites.description: Lightweight and strong! And don't worry, we're sure the glue will dry off in no time.

Electrics.description: We did know about electricity before inventing space flight. The big breakthrough here was combining the two.

Electronics.description: Hopefully these won't become obsolete in the next couple of months.

Engineering_101.description: How hard can Aerospace Engineering be anyway?

Experimental_Aerodynamics.description: Winged flight technology is soaring to unprecedented heights. It could even be said that it's properly taking off now.

Experimental_Electrics.description: The very latest in electrical systems technology. Our engineers are buzzing with excitement over it. They also seem to glow in the dark now. Fascinating!

Experimental_Science.description: Explore novel fields of science that we didn't even know were there.

Field_Science.description: Freedom to roam as far as curiosity will take you, or as long as the batteries last.

Flight_Control.description: Tumbling out of control may be fun, but our engineers insist there's more to rocket science than that.

Fuel_Systems.description: Advancements towards a better understanding of how fuel flows through a rocket.

General_Construction.description: New equipment to help out in keeping things stable, especially useful when the size of the spacecraft defies the current bounds of sanity.

General_Rocketry.description: More engines, more fuel, more ambitious ideas.

Heavier_Rocketry.description: There may be an upper limit to how large a rocket can be built, but we're not there yet.

Heavy_Aerodynamics.description: Advances in construction technology enabled new breakthroughs in aerospace materials.

Heavy_Landing.description: A good landing is one where you walk away from it. A great landing is one where you get to use the aircraft again.

Heavy_Rocketry.description: The next logical step for rocketry technology is to just go bigger.

High-Performance_Fuel_Systems.description: Massive engines require massive fuel storage solutions.

High-Power_Electrics.description: Maximize your energy production and storage potential by maximizing the size of the electrical components on your vessels.

High_Altitude_Flight.description: New breakthroughs in engine and intake development to enable flying through the upper reaches of the atmosphere.

Hypersonic_Flight.description: Push your aircraft to the upper limits of airspeed and sanity.

Ion_Propulsion.description: Turns out, it's not science fiction.

Landing.description: Our Engineers are nothing if not optimistic.

Large_Probes.description: The rumours of probe-led world domination are greatly exaggerated.

Large_Volume_Containment.description: Maximize the payload capacity of your spacecraft by maximizing the size of your spacecraft.

Meta-Materials.description: An advancement in spacecraft construction so revolutionary, you won't even mind that its naming was wildly inaccurate.

Miniaturization.description: These aren't your standard hobby miniature models. We've been assured they look good enough to actually fly.

Nuclear_Propulsion.description: Nuclear engines don't burn fuel, they totally annihilate it. We just hope it doesn't begin any conflicts.

Precision_Engineering.description: Precise engineering techniques allow for construction of even smaller parts.

Precision_Propulsion.description: Any level of precision achieved in controlling the sustained explosion inside a rocket engine is nothing short of remarkable. It might be quite expensive, too.

Propulsion_Systems.description: A positively different approach to existing trends in rocketry. These small, lightweight propulsion systems may not seem as exciting, but they might prove just as useful.

Science_Tech.description: Scientific advancements allow new advanced technologies for advancing Science.

Space_Exploration.description: To boldly go where no green man has gone before.

Specialized_Construction.description: Specialized construction techniques provide new ways of attaching things together, and detaching things on purpose.

Specialized_Control.description: A new state-of-the-art in control technology.

Specialized_Electrics.description: Experience the warm glow of the latest in electrical technology. Figuratively, of course, and maybe also quite literally as well. Actually, try to avoid direct exposure.

Stability.description: Reaching for the stars starts with keeping our spacecraft pointed generally in the right direction.

Start.description: The technology we started out with.

Supersonic_Flight.description: A new line of aircraft parts that allow for unprecedented maneuverability and speed.

Survivability.description: The art and science of landing and walking away from it.

Unmanned_Tech.description: Warning: May contain traces of sentience.

Very_Heavy_Rocketry.description: While ever-larger rockets may not be the answer every time, for all other times, we've developed these.
